# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here's how you could solve the problem in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    result = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result) 
            result *= " "
        end
        
        result *= word
    end
    
    return result
end
```
This function splits the input string into words, then iterates over each word. For each word, it checks if adding that word to the current line would exceed `text_width`. If so, it adds a new line (`\n`). If not, it just appends a space. The resulting string is the input text with lines wrapped as needed.
